revised_title: Observations of Concentric Envelopes and Arches in Prominences
tldr: The author analyzes photographs of solar prominences taken with a spectroheliograph and observes a series of concentric envelopes and arches. These formations indicate that either this form is a rare feature of prominence material or that the envelopes seldom appear broadside-on on the limb, allowing the arch system to be fully displayed.
